text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: Here! Canned mackerel mixed rice,<n>ready to eat! ☆

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
When we realized we'd be camping<n>out waiting for the first
bus, Hishi<n>Akebono whipped out a portable gas<n>burner
and multiple cooking utensils to<n>make us a delicious meal.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
Doesn't that smell good? I think it<n>turned out juuust right.
And don't<n>worry, there's plenty of leftovers, so<n>eat your
fill, okay? ♪

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
I take a bite and marvel at the flavors<n>I'm tasting. The warm
rice soothes<n>both my heart and aching body. I'm<n>
reminded of just how resourceful<n>she is in a pinch.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: Ehehe, thank you. ☆

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
But I wouldn't be half the cook I am<n>today without my
parents. They're<n>both amazing cooks themselves.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: The soups and hot pots they makeare filled with the sweetest of stocks,and their hamburgers and fried chicken are extra juicy.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
Whenever people taste their food, a<n>big smile follows each
bite. It's<n>absolutely amazing.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
Seeing that, I could feel this desire<n>well up inside me. I
wanna be a racer<n>that makes people smile too!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
That story didn't end how I expected<n>it to. Wouldn't it be
easier for her to<n>bring people joy through her<n>cooking?

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: Huh?

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Curious, I ask her why she would<n>enter Tracen instead of a
culinary<n>school.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: How do I put this... Hmmm, you see...

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: When I was a kid, I wanted to be a<n>big pot of chanko!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
My apparent confusion encourages<n>Hishi Akebono to
continue her story,<n>and she tells me of a television<n>special
she witnessed as a child.

text_block_list.name: Interviewer
text_block_list.text:
Today we'd like to highlight the hot<n>pot sumo wrestlers
often eat—chanko.<n>Our guests today are former sumo<n>
wrestlers who made this dish<n>regularly.

text_block_list.name: Former Sumo Wrestler
text_block_list.text:
Chanko is something we wrestlers<n>eat every day as a
group. It fills our<n>bellies while also giving us the energy<n>
needed to grow stronger.

text_block_list.name: Former Sumo Wrestler
text_block_list.text:
But it's especially important after a<n>hard-fought match. A
satisfying meal<n>enjoyed while surrounded by<n>friends...
Nothing gets you more ready<n>to keep working hard than
that.

text_block_list.name: Young Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
Woooow! Chanko's the best thing<n>everrr! So that's why
sumo wrestlers<n>are so strong! They eat lots and lots<n>of
the heartiest hot pot ever!

text_block_list.name: Young Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
When I grow up, I wanna be a pot of<n>chanko! Then I'll
gather everybody in<n>the same place and get 'em ready to<n>
work hard too!

text_block_list.name: Young Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: ...Uh-oh. If I'm the hot pot, does that<n>mean I can't have any?

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: Realizing that, I gave up onliterally becoming a pot of chanko.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
But even if I knew I couldn't actually<n>be a hot pot, that
special still stuck<n>with me. I read books on the subject,<n>
made my own recipes...

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
And then one day, I heard something<n>wonderful while
watching a<n>post-match interview on TV.

text_block_list.name: Sumo Wrestler
text_block_list.text:
He was strong, all right—too strong. I<n>can tell now that I
wasn't ready for<n>this fight, but... I still gave it everything<n>
I've got!

text_block_list.name: Young Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
Mama, why is the sumo wrestler<n>smiling? He lost, didn't
he? He was<n>crying just before...

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono's Mother
text_block_list.text:
Well... I'm sure he's proud of himself<n>and what he
managed to do.

text_block_list.name: Young Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: What do you mean?

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono's Mother
text_block_list.text:
Do you remember what he said? He<n>gave this fight
everything he's got.<n>Going up against a big, strong fighter<n>
is a lot harder than it sounds.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono's Mother
text_block_list.text: But he still did it. I'm sure he's very,<n>very happy.

text_block_list.name: Young Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
I get it... He's probably got a warm,<n>full feeling in his tummy.
That's...<n>kinda like what happens when they<n>eat chanko!

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono's Mother
text_block_list.text: ...What?

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
I think what little me was trying to say<n>is that if I can go up
against a strong<n>opponent with everything I got,<n>maybe I
can become a chanko after<n>all.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
I want to be a runner that gives every<n>race her all! That way,
whether I win<n>or lose, I'll still make people smile!

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: That's why I entered Tracen<n>Academy.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
Ah, hearing that must've been a bit of<n>a surprise, huh? Well,
I'm surprised<n>too!

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: To be honest, I think this is the firsttime I ever put my thoughts intowords. Obviously I knew I wanted tomake people smile with my racing, butI never really thought about why.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
Who would've thought a TV special<n>could have such an
effect on my<n>running. Ahahaha!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Her tale ended up being a bit of a<n>whirlwind experience for
both of us,<n>but I have a better idea of what<n>motivates her
now.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: Yawn...Finally back at school.What a trip, huh, Trainer?

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
We arrive back at the academy a little<n>after eight o' clock.
Despite my aching<n>body and a general lack of sleep, I<n>
don't actually feel that tired.
choice_data_list:
(Maybe Hishi Akebono's resilience is rubbing
off on me.)

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
No one could tell she just spend the<n>night camping. In fact,
she looks<n>incredibly well-rested.

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text:
Well, I've got a scrimmage today, so I<n>should get going. Go
home and get<n>plenty of rest, okay?

text_block_list.name: Hishi Akebono
text_block_list.text: Yeah. Huh? Didn't I tell you?
